I have it set up to be totally wireless between my main desktop and two laptops in different rooms. And it is not wireless just for printing but for scanning too. It did take me one 10 minute phone call to get it properly set up, but after that, it was good to go.

Had to improve the print quality to fine instead of standard. Much better for photos in brochure. Which slowed printing down, but still very good. What a nice feature that worked fantastic. Epson inks are still toooo expensive, so I'll use no name, like I have for years on many Epsons. Epson has been our choice forever. The C88's just won't quit. Hope this is as good or better.

Item.Item: Epson WorkForce 845 Color Ink-jet - Fax / copier / printer / scanner
Item.Review:
Pros: Fast Print Time; Easy To Use; Easy To Set Up; Low Ink Consumption
Immediately I loved this printer. At first I thought I would not be able to print my own business cards or labels, but after I checked the settings within the computer I realized you need to change from FAST printing to QUALITY (slower). Once that is done it prints and registers fine. For most uses I would recommmend this printer. I do not print many photographs, so if that's what you want to do, I would focus on buying one that advertises for that purpose. However if you are printing documents, business cards, etc., this printer works great. Don't get me wrong, I've printed a few photographs and it's fine. You can put it on fast printing for black and white and it is amazing. I couldn't believe it when I se ... t it up. I had been using a Canon before and it took it 45 seconds to a minute to "warm up"! This printer is fast if you need it to be and you can change the quality speed otherwise. I liked the two tray option, digital screen, wifi was a quick set up. Some people have mentioned the noise level, but this printer is so fast, so what? I didn't notice any major noise level myself. The only thing I wish it had was a rear load tray for the card stock and business cards, only for convenience. Since it has two trays I do load card stock in there so that works fine. This machine is shorter and a little smaller than last year's model. It seems that the ink cartridges are staying full longer on this printer than previous ones. Overall, I would give it a 4.5 stars, 1/2 star taken off for the slightly flimsy paper rest that you pull out and no rear tray. expand » « collapse

I have been a loyal HP user for over 20 years. That all ended when I decided to switch to this Epson after doing a little research. I am SOO glad I did my research. This Epson is by far the best printer I've ever owned. I work from my home and need a reliable printer for photos and documents. I also need a good scanner to email documents and occasionally a fax. This printer does all of that and very easily and it works with my wireless network seamlessly. The printer screen is very user friendly and is a touch screen. I recommend this printer for anyone that runs a small business from their home.

Item.Review:

Cons: Couldn't scan wirelessly
Within the past 5 years, we've had 2 HP printers, both of which stopped working correctly within the first 2 years of limited use. We decided to try Epson this time to see if our experience was better. Though we've only had the printer for a few short months, it has been easy to use and figure out. The print quality is great and we noticed that if a printed page accidently gets wet, the ink did not run like the HP. Item.Item: Epson WorkForce 845 Color Ink-jet - Fax / copier / printer / scanner
Item.Review:
Pros: Fast, reliable (so far)
Cons: Menu not intuitive; software not all-in-one
I am reluctant to review this printer after using it for only a few weeks, because to me one of the most important properties of a printer is how reliably it functions after months and years of use. I bought this printer because my previous printer (manufactured by a major, well-known company) suddenly lost the capacity to print in black ink after over a year of excellent, reliable performance. I went with the Epson Workforce 845 because it was the highest-rated printer (with a substantial number of reviewers) at Best Buy and because I have had an excellent experience with an Epson printer I use at work, the RX595.
Thus far, the printer has functioned solidly, printing clear pages quickly. ... The paper has jammed a couple of times, but it was due to user error, and the jam was quickly and easily cleared with no lingering problems. I have only a couple of minor complaints so far. First, the menu system on the printer itself is not intuitive, in my opinion. The initial, home menu is clear enough, showing basic options to copy, fax, scan, print pictures, and a few other choices. But after choosing one of these options, I found myself faced with an icon-based menu in which it was not clear what all the icons would do. For example, what will happen if I touch the box with the letter "c" in it on the copy page? What about the diamond shape with a vertical line through it? Obviously the functions of these icons can be learned by trial-and-error (not ideal) or by reading the manual (god forbid), but it would have been nicer to have icons with clearer meanings and/or text options.
The other minor complaint I have is the software provided for my computer. My previous printer had a nice "all-in-one center" where I could begin no matter what my task (print settings, fax, scanning, etc.). With the Epson workforce, I have to pull up a different program from my Windows 7 menu for any task. Choosing "All Programs" from Windows 7 start, I find three different Epson folders: EPSON, EP ... expand » « collapse
